title: 111_hr5928
content: The "Veterans' Disability Claims Efficiency Act of 2010" aims to improve the disability claims processing for veterans. The "Veterans' Disability Claims Efficiency Act of 2010" includes the establishment of Fast Track Interim Disability Ratings for veterans submitting claims for compensation. The Secretary can assign interim disability ratings for conditions that do not require further development, expediting the review process. The Secretary can assign disability ratings for conditions that do not need further development. If a disability rating can be assigned for a condition, it will be combined with any interim ratings previously assigned. For conditions rated less than the maximum rate, development will continue. The Secretary can assign disability ratings for conditions that do not need further development. Ratings assigned under paragraph (1)(B) for a condition will remain unless an increased rating is assigned later. A fast track claim review process will be established for prioritizing initial claims for disability compensation. The Secretary conducts a preliminary review of initial disability claims to determine quick adjudication potential, priority treatment eligibility, and temporary disability rating feasibility. Priority is given to initial claims adjudication, with exceptions outlined. The Secretary prioritizes initial disability claims for quick adjudication based on potential quick resolution and claimant impact. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit a report on the implementation of sections 1157(b) and 5103B of title 38, United States Code, as well as the efficiency of employees processing disability compensation claims. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit a report on the implementation of sections 1157(b) and 5103B of title 38, United States Code, as well as the efficiency of employees processing disability compensation claims. The report will include information on the complexity of claims in relation to employee experience and skills, pilot programs for claim review and process, status updates, evaluation of best practices, and potential expansion. Additionally, an update to the report will be submitted to congressional committees 18 months after the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit an update to the report on disability compensation claims to the appropriate congressional committees. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of the Act, applying to claims filed two years after that date.
